conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the system using Newton's laws of motion.
The system includes a child, pillow, ball, and a guide rail at angle α with a rope at angle β.
Identify the forces: gravitational force, tension in the rope, and normal force from the guide rail.
Tension in the rope is T, acting at angle β relative to vertical.
Normal force N is perpendicular to the guide rail.
Break down tension and gravitational forces into components parallel and perpendicular to the guide rail.
Component of gravitational force along the incline is (m1 + m2)g sin α.
Component of tension force along the incline is T cos β.
Net force along the incline is zero: T cos β = (m1 + m2)g sin α.
Component of gravitational force perpendicular to the incline is (m1 + m2)g cos α.
Component of tension force perpendicular to the incline is T sin β.
Normal force N balances these forces: N + T sin β = (m1 + m2)g cos α.
From parallel force equation, T = ((m1 + m2)g sin α) / cos β.
Force exerted by the pillow on the child is proportional to their combined weight.
Ratio of tension T to force exerted by the pillow on the child is sin α / cos β.
Final answer: The ratio is sin α / cos β.
